member.name: T:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference
member.summary: Represents an assembly reference used by the Web site.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets a reference to the project in the object that contains this Web service.
member.returns: A object that can be cast to a object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.DTE
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that contains the project containing this Web service.
member.returns: An object, which is a reference to the automation object to which the .asmx file belongs.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.FullPath
member.summary: Gets the full local path to the assembly.
member.returns: A string containing the full local path to the assembly.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.Name
member.summary: Gets the assembly name for the reference.
member.returns: A string containing the assembly name.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.ReferencedProject
member.summary: Gets a reference to the project in the object that references this Web service.
member.returns: A object that can be cast to a object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.ReferenceKind
member.summary: Gets the type of the assembly reference.
member.returns: An object.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.Remove
member.summary: Removes this assembly reference from the Web site.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReference.StrongName
member.summary: Gets the strong name for the assembly.
member.returns: A string containing the strong name for the assembly.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences
member.summary: Provides access to the collection of references used in the Web site project.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.AddFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an object to the collection from the specified file path.
member.returns: An object.
member.param: The path to a .dll file to be added.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.AddFromGAC(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an object representing an assembly in the GAC.
member.returns: An object.
member.param: The fully qualified strong name of an assembly in the GAC.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.AddFromProject(EnvDTE.Project)
member.summary: Adds an object from another project.
member.param: The fully qualified strong name of an assembly.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets a reference to the project in the object that contains this Web service.
member.returns: A object that can be cast to a object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.Count
member.summary: Gets the total number of items in the collection.
member.returns: The total number of elements in the collection.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.DTE
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that contains the project containing this Web service.
member.returns: An object, which is a reference to the automation object to which the file belongs.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.
member.returns: An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.AssemblyReferences.Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves an item from the collection.
member.returns: An assembly reference object.
member.param: The index of the item within the collection.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.CodeFolder
member.summary: Represents the App_Code folder, or a first-level child of the App_Code folder that is configured as a code folder.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.CodeModel
member.summary: Gets the object for the code folder.
member.returns: A object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets a reference to the project in the object that contains this code folder.
member.returns: An object that can be cast to a object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.DTE
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that contains the project containing this code folder.
member.returns: An object, which is a reference to the automation object to which the code folder belongs.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.FolderPath
member.summary: Gets the path and name for the folder.
member.returns: The path and name of the folder.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.Language
member.summary: Gets the language configured for the folder.
member.returns: A string indicating the language of the code in the folder.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.ProjectItem
member.summary: The project item for the code folder.
member.returns: A object.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.CodeFolder.Remove
member.summary: Removes the <add directoryName="folderName"> node from the <codeSubDirectories> element of the <compilation> section of the Web.config file for this Web site.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.CodeFolders
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects, where each item represents either the App_Code folder or one of its first-level child folders configured as a code folder.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.CodeFolders.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a object from the specified path to the collection.
member.returns: A object.
member.param: The path to a code folder to be added.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolders.ContainingProject
member.summary: Gets a reference to the project in the object that contains this Web service.
member.returns: A object that can be cast to a object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolders.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of folders in the collection.
member.returns: The number of folders in the collection property of a object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.CodeFolders.DTE
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object that contains the project containing this Web service.
member.returns: An object, which is a reference to the automation object to which the .asmx file belongs.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.CodeFolders.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the items in the collection.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.CodeFolders.Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the at the specified index.
member.returns: The object at the specified index in the collection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the or the relative path for the folder to retrieve from the collection.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.OpenWebsiteOptions
member.summary: Specifies how the Web site can be opened.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.OpenWebsiteOptions.OpenWebsiteOption_None
member.summary: Open the Web site with no special options.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.OpenWebsiteOptions.OpenWebsiteOption_UsePassiveFTP
member.summary: Open the Web Site with FTP in passive mode. This option is ignored for non-FTP Web sites.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.OpenWebsiteOptions.OpenWebsiteOption_UseFrontpageForLocalhost
member.summary: Open the Web site with the local IIS Web server (localhost) using Front Page server extensions, This value is ignored in all other cases.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.PrjBrowseObjectCATID
member.summary: Specifies the category ID (CATID) for a project object.

member.summary: Provides a GUID used to extend the collection.

member.summary: Provides a GUID used to extend the collection.

member.summary: Provides a GUID used to extend the collection.

member.summary: Opens a Web site.
member.returns: An object.
member.param: The URL of the Web site to open. This can be a path to a folder on disk, an HTTP URL, or an FTP URL. This parameter does not support URLs that use the file:// protocol.
A object that specifies how the Web site can be opened.
A Boolean value determining whether the Web site is added to the solution.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.VSWebSite
member.summary: Provides properties and methods for a Web site project.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.VSWebSite.AddFromTemplate(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new in the Web site project.
member.returns: A object.
member.param: A relative URL for the folder in which to create the object. If this parameter is null or an empty string, the item is added to the root of the project.
The name of a template to use in creating the object.
The code language for the object; for example, "C#" or "VB."
The name of the object as you want it to be within the project.
A Boolean value indicating whether to use the code-behind model. This parameter is used only when the project supports code-behind files; otherwise it is ignored.
The relative path and name of the master page for projects that support master pages, and if applicable, the template; otherwise this parameter is ignored.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.VSWebSite.EnsureServerRunning

member.returns: The URL for the Web site.

member.name: M:VsWebSite.VSWebSite.GetUniqueFilename(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a filename that is unique within the specified folder, using the specified root name and file name extension.
member.returns: A file name with an extension that is unique within the specified folder.
member.param: The relative path to the folder where the file name must be unique. Use "/" as the path separator; do not start or end the folder name with a "/" character.
The base name for the file, such as "default" or "HomePage".
The extension for the file name, including the dot, such as ".aspx" or ".xml".

member.name: M:VsWebSite.VSWebSite.PreCompileWeb(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compiles the Web site and writes the compiled output to the specified folder.
member.returns: true if the compilation was successful; otherwise false.
member.param: The local file system path of the folder where the compiled Web site will be written.
A flag indicating whether the Web site is updatable or whether it requires recompilation when an .aspx file is changed.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.BrowseURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for running the Web site.
member.returns: The URL for browsing the Web site. The property can be set only for file system Web sites or for FTP sites. Sites that use IIS use the URL with which they was opened.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.CurrentWebsiteLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current code language for the Web site project.
member.returns: The name of the code language for the Web site, such as "VB" or "C#".

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableASPXDebugging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable debugging for .aspx files when invoking the debugger for the Web site project.
member.returns: true if debugging is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableFxCop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable Code Analysis (FxCop) in the Web site project.
member.returns: true if Code Analysis is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableNTLMAuthentication
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ASP.NET Development Server uses NTLM authentication.
member.returns: true if NTLM authentication is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableSQLServerDebugging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to also invoke SQL debugging when invoking the debugger for the Web site project.
member.returns: true if SQL Server debugging is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableUnmanagedDebugging
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to also invoke native code debugging when invoking the debugger for the Web site.
member.returns: true if native code debugging is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableVsWebServer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use the ASP.NET Development Server for running file system Web site projects.
member.returns: true if the ASP.NET Development Server is enabled; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.EnableVsWebServerDynamicPort
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the ASP.NET Development Server uses a dynamic port for access.
member.returns: true if ASP.NET Development Server uses a dynamic port; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.Extender(System.String)
member.summary: Provides internal-only access to Web site properties.
member.returns: An extender object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.ExtenderCATID
member.summary: Provides internal-only access to project properties.
member.returns: A GUID representing the CATID of the object.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.ExtenderNames
member.summary: Provides internal-only access to project properties.
member.returns: An object containing an automation-compliant array of strings.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.FullPath
member.summary: The physical path for the Web site project. For remote Web sites, this is the path to the temporary local cache location for the Web site.
member.returns: The full physical path for the Web site project.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.FxCopRuleAssemblies
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of assemblies containing Code Analysis (FxCop) rules. This property supports Code Analysis and is not intended to be used in your code.
member.returns: A collection of assemblies that contain Code Analysis (FxCop) rules.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.FxCopRules
member.summary: Gets or sets the rules for diagnostic Code Analysis (FxCop). This property supports Code Analysis and is not intended to be used in your code.
member.returns: The rules for diagnostic Code Analysis (FxCop).

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.OpenedURL
member.summary: Gets the URL used to open the Web site project.
member.returns: The URL used to open the Web site project.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.ProjectDirty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Web site project has changed since it was last opened.
member.returns: true if the Web site project has changed; otherwise false.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.StartAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of action to take when debugging the Web site.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.StartArguments
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the arguments to use when starting the Web site.
member.returns: The arguments for starting the Web site with the value of the property.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.StartPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the page to use when starting the Web site.
member.returns: The name of the starting page for the Web site.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.StartProgram
member.summary: Gets or sets the path and file name of an executable file to run when starting the Web site.
member.returns: The path and file name for the executable file to run when starting the Web site.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.StartURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting URL for the Web site.
member.returns: The URL to use when starting the Web site.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.StartWorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets the physical starting directory for the application represented by the specified Web site.
member.returns: The physical path to the starting directory.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.VsWebServerPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the current port number for the ASP.NET Development Server.
member.returns: The current port number for the Web server if the Web site is configured to use the ASP.NET Development Server and if the property is true; otherwise, 0 (zero).

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties.WebSiteType
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the type of the specified Web site.
member.returns: A value.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties2
member.summary: Represents the properties that are supported by a Web site project in Visual Studio.

member.name: P:VsWebSite.WebSiteProperties2.VsWebServerVPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual path for the Visual Studio Web server.
member.returns: The virtual path for the Visual Studio Web server.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.webStartAction
member.summary: Specifies how the Web application is started when the user runs the Web site in Visual Studio.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webStartAction.webStartActionCurrentPage
member.summary: The currently selected Web page is used to start the application.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webStartAction.webStartActionSpecificPage
member.summary: The page specified by the property is used to start the Web application. You can manually add a query string in order to pass parameters to the page.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webStartAction.webStartActionProgram
member.summary: The property is used to start the Web application. This property uses arguments from the property. The working directory is specified by the property.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webStartAction.webStartActionURL
member.summary: The URL specified in the property is used to start the Web application. The browser will be launched using this URL.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webStartAction.webStartActionNoStartPage
member.summary: A connection to the Web server is established, but no other action is taken. The browser is not launched.

member.name: T:VsWebSite.webType
member.summary: Specifies how the Web site was opened.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webType.webTypeFileSystem
member.summary: The Web site was opened from the file system.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webType.webTypeLocalhost
member.summary: The Web site was opened from IIS on the current computer. Access is through the file system.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webType.webTypeFTP
member.summary: The Web site was opened through FTP.

member.name: F:VsWebSite.webType.webTypeFrontPage
member.summary: The Web site was opened through Front Page server extensions. The enumeration value can include localhost sites.
